question: In distributed systems, a logical clock is associated with ______________
options: ['a) each instruction', 'b) each process', 'c) each register', 'd) none of the mentioned']

question: If timestamps of two events are same, then the events are ____________
If a process is executing in its critical section ____________
options: ['a) any other process can also execute in its critical section', 'b) no other process can execute in its critical section', 'c) one more process can execute in its critical section', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option1: a) any other process can also execute in its critical section
option2: b) no other process can execute in its critical section
option3: c) one more process can execute in its critical section

question: A process can enter into its critical section ____________
options: ['a) anytime', 'b) when it receives a reply message from its parent process', 'c) when it receives a reply message from all other processes in the system', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option2: b) when it receives a reply message from its parent process
option3: c) when it receives a reply message from all other processes in the system

question: For proper synchronization in distributed systems ____________
options: ['a) prevention from the deadlock is must', 'b) prevention from the starvation is must', 'c) prevention from the deadlock & starvation is must', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option1: a) prevention from the deadlock is must
option2: b) prevention from the starvation is must
option3: c) prevention from the deadlock & starvation is must

question: In the token passing approach of distributed systems, processes are organized in a ring structure ____________
options: ['a) logically', 'b) physically', 'c) both logically and physically', 'd) none of the mentioned']

question: In distributed systems, what will the transaction coordinator do?
options: ['a) starts the execution of transaction', 'b) breaks the transaction into number of sub transactions', 'c) coordinates the termination of the transaction', 'd) all of the mentioned']
option1: a) starts the execution of transaction
option2: b) breaks the transaction into number of sub transactions
option3: c) coordinates the termination of the transaction

question: In case of failure, a new transaction coordinator can be elected by ____________
options: ['a) bully algorithm', 'b) ring algorithm', 'c) both bully and ring algorithm', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option3: c) both bully and ring algorithm

question: In distributed systems, election algorithms assumes that ____________
options: ['a) a unique priority number is associated with each active process in system', 'b) there is no priority number associated with any process', 'c) priority of the processes is not required', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option1: a) a unique priority number is associated with each active process in system
option2: b) there is no priority number associated with any process
option3: c) priority of the processes is not required

question: According to the ring algorithm, links between processes are ____________
options: ['a) bidirectional', 'b) unidirectional', 'c) both bidirectional and unidirectional', 'd) none of the mentioned']
